issue.title: [CF 213] Bars not showing on screen
issue.body:
Same as ticket below, typing /tmw does not bring up the tmw options, i can navigate to them from the interface/addons menu and it appears to be active although i cannot see it. When i /tmw i hear a sound like when you open talent window for example but nothing appears. Resettng the addon to default causes it to work again but once set up again and following a reload ui or relog i can again no longer see it.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
4.3.0 beta

Do you have an error log of what happened?
Message: Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1039: bad argument #1 to 'pairs' (table expected, got nil)
Time: 05/29/11 22:37:58
Count: 1
Stack: [C]: ?
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1039: in function `group'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1568: in function `Upgrade'
Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:799: in function <Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:752>
[C]: ?
[string "safecall Dispatcher[1]"]:3: in function <[string "safecall Dispatcher[1]"]:3>
[C]: ?
[string "safecall Dispatcher[1]"]:9: in function <[string "safecall Dispatcher[1]"]:5>
(tail call): ?
Interface\AddOns\Ace3\AceAddon-3.0\AceAddon-3.0.lua:514: in function `InitializeAddon'
Interface\AddOns\Ace3\AceAddon-3.0\AceAddon-3.0.lua:628: in function <Interface\AddOns\Ace3\AceAddon-3.0\AceAddon-3.0.lua:621>

Locals: (*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = "table expected, got nil"
= <function> defined =[C]:-1

Please provide any additional information below (including the export string of the icon if applicable; see above.
Not sure if it has any bearing on it but the addon Debuff Filter has also stopped working in the same manner as this one (it is still active and working but not showing on screen) and at the same time apporoximatly. I have tried running both with the other off but it does not work


> Posted by CurseForge user tomthumb112 | Imported from CurseForge issue #213 | Raw

comments.body:
Got the release version 4.2.1.2 and it seems to be working now, ill post again if the error returns


> Posted by CurseForge user tomthumb112
